metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Incorporates all 303 active SP 800-53 Rev 5 controls including new Rev 5 additions (CM-12, CM-13, CM-14, AT-06, SC-44, SC-45, SI-16, SC-47, SC-48, IR-09). Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: CM-08 directly covers component inventory with automated discovery and tracking enhancements. CM-12 (new in Rev 5) addresses information location, strengthening asset-to-data mapping. PM-05 system inventory. Comprehensive asset management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS 1 includes active/passive asset discovery techniques; CM-08 enhancements and CM-12 information location cover the intent.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory
clauses.rationale: CM-08 directly requires system component inventory with detail. CM-12 (new in Rev 5) adds information location tracking which strengthens asset-data linkage.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Address Unauthorized Assets
clauses.rationale: CM-08(03) covers automated unauthorized component detection and remediation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Utilize DHCP Logging to Update Enterprise Asset Inventory
clauses.rationale: AU-03 audit record content; CM-08(01) updates during various events; CM-12 information location tracking. DHCP logging as specific implementation not prescribed but intent is covered.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 does not specifically address DHCP logging for inventory updates. General audit and inventory controls apply.

clauses.title: Use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Logging to Update Enterprise Asset Inventory
clauses.rationale: AU-03 audit content; SI-04 system monitoring; CM-12 information location. DHCP-specific logging not explicitly addressed but monitoring controls cover the concept.
clauses.gaps: DHCP logging is a specific implementation technique not called out in SP 800-53. General monitoring and audit controls provide coverage of the intent.

clauses.title: Use a Passive Asset Discovery Tool
clauses.rationale: CM-08(01) updates during events; CM-08(02) automated maintenance and verification; CM-12 information location. Passive discovery concept covered by automated inventory mechanisms.
clauses.gaps: Specific passive discovery tooling not prescribed; general automated inventory mechanisms and information location controls cover the intent.

clauses.title: Inventory and Control of Software Assets
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-08 component inventory (includes software); CM-10 software usage restrictions; CM-11 user-installed software; CM-12 information location; CM-14 (new in Rev 5) signed components for integrity verification; SA-22 unsupported components.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. New Rev 5 controls strengthen software inventory and integrity verification.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
clauses.rationale: CM-08 component inventory includes software; CM-10 software usage restrictions require inventory; CM-12 information location adds data-to-software linkage.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported
clauses.rationale: SA-22 directly addresses unsupported system components including software end-of-life management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Address Unauthorized Software
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality (application whitelisting); CM-11 user-installed software restrictions. Together these address discovery and remediation of unauthorized software.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Utilize Automated Software Inventory Tools
clauses.rationale: CM-08(02) automated maintenance of inventory; CM-10 software usage restrictions; CM-12 information location. Automated software discovery covered through inventory automation controls.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically calls for automated software inventory tools. SP 800-53 requires automated inventory mechanisms generally; specific software-focused tooling is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Allowlist Authorized Software
clauses.rationale: CM-07(04) and CM-07(05) directly address application whitelisting/allowlisting with binary or hash-level enforcement.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Allowlist Authorized Libraries
clauses.rationale: CM-07 application allowlisting; CM-14 (new in Rev 5) signed components adds library integrity verification; SA-10 developer configuration management.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically addresses library-level allowlisting. SP 800-53 allowlisting is at application level; CM-14 signed components and library-specific control are partially addressed.

clauses.title: Allowlist Authorized Scripts
clauses.rationale: CM-07(04)/(05) application allowlisting covers scripts conceptually. Script execution policies can be implemented under least functionality.
clauses.gaps: Script-specific allowlisting is a subset of application allowlisting. CM-07 enhancements cover the intent but script-level granularity is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Data Protection
clauses.rationale: SC-28 data at rest; SC-08 data in transit; MP family media protection; AC-04 information flow; RA-02 data classification; SI-12 information lifecycle; CM-12 (new in Rev 5) information location; CM-13 (new in Rev 5) data action mapping; PT family privacy. Rev 5 additions strengthen data management coverage.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS 3 includes specific data management processes (inventory, disposal, flow diagrams). SP 800-53 now covers better with CM-12/CM-13 but data management lifecycle is still somewhat distributed across controls.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Management Process
clauses.rationale: SI-12 information management; PM-01 security program includes data management; CM-13 (new in Rev 5) data action mapping documents data processing lifecycle.
clauses.gaps: CIS requires specific data management process documentation. SP 800-53 addresses through various controls; CM-13 improves coverage with data action mapping but a unified data management process control is still distributed.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Inventory
clauses.rationale: RA-02 security categorization requires data identification; CM-08 component inventory; CM-12 (new in Rev 5) information location directly tracks where data resides; CM-13 data action mapping; PM-05 system inventory.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires data inventory. CM-12 information location and CM-13 data action mapping significantly close the gap from previous versions. Still somewhat implicit rather than a single dedicated data catalog control.

clauses.title: Configure Data Access Control Lists
clauses.rationale: AC-03 access enforcement; AC-06 least privilege. Direct and comprehensive mapping.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Enforce Data Retention
clauses.rationale: SI-12 information lifecycle management; AU-11 audit record retention. Together these cover retention requirements.
clauses.gaps: CIS covers data retention broadly across all data types. SP 800-53 addresses retention for specific data types (audit records via AU-11, general information via SI-12).

clauses.title: Securely Dispose of Data
clauses.rationale: MP-06 media sanitization; SI-12 information lifecycle management; SR-12 component disposal. Secure disposal comprehensively covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Encrypt Data on End-User Devices
clauses.rationale: SC-28 protection of information at rest; SC-28(01) cryptographic protection. Full-disk and file-level encryption covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifies end-user devices specifically; SC-28 covers information at rest generally which includes end-user devices.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Classification Scheme
clauses.rationale: RA-02 security categorization directly addresses data classification using FIPS 199 categorization or organizational equivalent.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS uses classification levels (public, internal, sensitive, confidential); SP 800-53 uses FIPS 199 categorization (low, moderate, high). Conceptually aligned but terminology differs.

clauses.title: Document Data Flows
clauses.rationale: AC-04 information flow enforcement requires understanding data flows; CM-12 information location; CM-13 (new in Rev 5) data action mapping directly documents data processing flows; PL-08 security architecture.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically requires data flow documentation. CM-13 data action mapping significantly closes this gap. AC-04 requires understanding flows for enforcement but explicit documentation less mandated.

clauses.title: Encrypt Data on Removable Media
clauses.rationale: MP-04 media storage with encryption; MP-05 media transport protection; SC-28(01) cryptographic protection of information at rest. Removable media encryption well covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data in Transit
clauses.rationale: SC-08 transmission confidentiality/integrity; SC-08(01) cryptographic protection. Direct and comprehensive mapping.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data at Rest
clauses.rationale: SC-28 protection of information at rest; SC-28(01) cryptographic protection. Direct and comprehensive mapping.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Segment Data Processing and Storage Based on Sensitivity
clauses.rationale: SC-32 system partitioning; AC-04 information flow enforcement; SC-07 boundary protection. Data segmentation by sensitivity well addressed through partitioning and flow controls.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS frames this as data-centric segmentation; SP 800-53 achieves this through system partitioning and information flow enforcement.

clauses.title: Deploy a Data Loss Prevention Solution
clauses.rationale: AC-04 information flow enforcement; PE-19 information leakage; SC-07 boundary protection; SI-04 system monitoring. DLP intent covered through multiple controls.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically addresses DLP tooling. SP 800-53 covers information flow enforcement and monitoring but integrated DLP as a specific technology category is distributed across controls rather than a single dedicated control.

clauses.title: Log Sensitive Data Access
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; AU-03 audit content; AU-12 audit record generation; AC-06(09) log use of privileged functions. Logging of sensitive data access comprehensively covered through audit controls.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software
clauses.rationale: CM-02 baseline configuration; CM-06 configuration settings; CM-07 least functionality; CM-03 change control. Comprehensive configuration management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process
clauses.rationale: CM-01 configuration management policy; CM-02 baseline configuration; CM-06 configuration settings. Direct and comprehensive mapping.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process for Network Infrastructure
clauses.rationale: CM-06 configuration settings applies to network devices; SC-07 boundary protection configuration. Network-specific configuration well covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Configure Automatic Session Locking on Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: AC-11 device lock / session lock; AC-11(01) pattern-hiding displays. Direct mapping for session lock/timeout.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on Servers
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection; SC-07(05) deny by default/allow by exception. Host-based firewall concept covered through boundary protection controls.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifically calls for host-based firewall on servers; SC-07 covers boundary protection generally including host-based mechanisms.

clauses.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on End-User Devices
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection; SC-07(05) deny by default/allow by exception. Endpoint firewall covered through boundary protection controls.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifically calls for host-based firewall on end-user devices; SC-07 covers boundary protection generally.

clauses.title: Securely Manage Enterprise Assets and Software
clauses.rationale: CM-05 access restrictions for change; CM-06 configuration settings; AC-17 remote access for management. Secure management channels and practices covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS emphasizes secure management practices including encrypted management protocols; SP 800-53 covers through access restrictions and remote access controls.

clauses.title: Manage Default Accounts on Enterprise Assets and Software
clauses.rationale: AC-02 account management; CM-06 configuration settings (disable/change defaults); IA-05 authenticator management for changing default passwords.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-07(01) periodic review. Directly addresses disabling unnecessary services, ports, and protocols.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Configure Trusted DNS Servers on Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: SC-20 secure name/address resolution (authoritative source); SC-21 secure name/address resolution (recursive/caching resolver); SC-22 architecture and provisioning for DNS.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically requires configuring enterprise assets to use trusted DNS servers. SP 800-53 DNS controls focus on DNS security architecture rather than endpoint DNS configuration.

clauses.title: Enforce Automatic Device Lockout on Portable End-User Devices
clauses.rationale: AC-07 unsuccessful logon attempts (lockout); AC-11 device lock/session lock. Device lockout and auto-lock well covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Enforce Remote Wipe Capability on Portable End-User Devices
clauses.rationale: AC-19 access control for mobile devices; AC-19(04) restrictions on classified information; MP-06 media sanitization. Remote wipe intent partially covered.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires remote wipe capability for lost/stolen devices. SP 800-53 covers mobile device access control and media sanitization but remote wipe as a specific technical capability is less explicitly mandated.

clauses.title: Separate Enterprise Workspaces on Mobile End-User Devices
clauses.rationale: AC-19 access control for mobile devices; SC-32 system partitioning. Workspace separation concept covered through mobile access controls and partitioning.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically addresses containerization and enterprise workspace separation on mobile devices. SP 800-53 covers mobile access control and partitioning concepts but BYOD containerization is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Account Management
clauses.rationale: AC-02 comprehensive account management; AC-05 separation of duties; AC-06 least privilege; IA-04 identifier management; IA-05 authenticator management; IA-02 identification and authentication.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 AC/IA families are comprehensive for account management.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-02 directly requires account inventory, review, and management including privileged, service, and user accounts.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Use Unique Passwords
clauses.rationale: IA-05 authenticator management; IA-05(01) password-based authentication including complexity, history, and uniqueness requirements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Disable Dormant Accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-02(03) directly covers disabling inactive/dormant accounts after a defined period.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Restrict Administrator Privileges to Dedicated Administrator Accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-06(05) privileged accounts; restricts privileged functions to dedicated accounts. Direct mapping.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-02 account management includes service accounts; IA-04 identifier management covers all account types including service accounts.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifically calls out service accounts; AC-02 covers all account types.

clauses.title: Centralize Account Management
clauses.rationale: AC-02(01) automated account management; IA-02 identification and authentication at information system level. Centralized account management through directory services implied.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically requires centralizing account management. SP 800-53 supports this through automated account management but centralization of directory services is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Access Control Management
clauses.rationale: AC family comprehensively covers access control management: AC-01 policy; AC-02 account management; AC-03 enforcement; AC-06 least privilege; AC-17 remote access; AC-24 access control decisions.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish an Access Granting Process
clauses.rationale: AC-02 account management includes access granting procedures; AC-06 least privilege ensures minimal necessary access. Direct mapping.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish an Access Revoking Process
clauses.rationale: AC-02 account deprovisioning; PS-04 personnel termination (access revocation); PS-05 personnel transfer (access review/modification).
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Require MFA for Externally-Exposed Applications
clauses.rationale: IA-02(01) multi-factor authentication for privileged accounts; IA-02(02) multi-factor authentication for non-privileged accounts. External-facing MFA comprehensively covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Require MFA for Remote Network Access
clauses.rationale: AC-17 remote access with MFA requirement; IA-02(01) multi-factor for privileged accounts. Remote access MFA directly addressed.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Require MFA for Administrative Access
clauses.rationale: IA-02(01) directly requires MFA for privileged/administrative accounts.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Authentication and Authorization Systems
clauses.rationale: AC-02 account management; IA-04 identifier management; PM-05 system inventory. Authentication system inventory partially covered through account management and system inventory.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires inventory of authentication/authorization systems (AD, LDAP, SSO, MFA providers). SP 800-53 covers account and system inventory but specific auth system enumeration is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Centralize Access Control
clauses.rationale: AC-02(01) automated account management; AC-03 access enforcement; AC-24 access control decisions. Centralized enforcement supported.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically requires centralization of access control. SP 800-53 supports centralized enforcement but doesn't mandate centralization of all access control systems into a single solution.

clauses.title: Define and Maintain Role-Based Access Control
clauses.rationale: AC-02(07) privileged user accounts (role-based); AC-03(07) role-based access control; AC-06 least privilege. RBAC directly addressed.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Continuous Vulnerability Management
clauses.rationale: RA-05 vulnerability monitoring/scanning; SI-02 flaw remediation; SI-05 security alerts/advisories; CA-07 continuous monitoring. Comprehensive vulnerability management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Vulnerability Management Process
clauses.rationale: RA-05 directly establishes vulnerability management process including scanning frequency, scope, and reporting.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Remediation Process
clauses.rationale: SI-02 flaw remediation; CA-05 plan of action and milestones (POA&M) for tracking remediation efforts and timelines.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Operating System Patch Management
clauses.rationale: SI-02 flaw remediation; SI-02(01) central management of flaw remediation including automated patching. OS-level patching addressed.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses automated OS-level patching. SI-02 covers flaw remediation generally with automated enhancement.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Application Patch Management
clauses.rationale: SI-02(01) central management of flaw remediation; SI-02(02) automated flaw remediation status. Application-level patching automation covered.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses application-level patching automation. SI-02 enhancements cover the intent.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: RA-05 vulnerability scanning; RA-05(02) update scanning tools; RA-05(05) privileged access scanning. Internal automated scanning comprehensively covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets
clauses.rationale: RA-05 vulnerability scanning includes external-facing assets; RA-05(02) update scanning tools for current signatures.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifies external asset scanning cadence; RA-05 covers all vulnerability scanning.

clauses.title: Remediate Detected Vulnerabilities
clauses.rationale: SI-02 flaw remediation; CA-05 plan of action and milestones; RA-05 vulnerability response and risk-based remediation prioritization.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Audit Log Management
clauses.rationale: AU family comprehensively covers audit logging: events (AU-02), content (AU-03), capacity (AU-04), response (AU-05), review (AU-06), reduction (AU-07), timestamps (AU-08), protection (AU-09), non-repudiation (AU-10), retention (AU-11), generation (AU-12). SC-45 (new in Rev 5) system time synchronization strengthens timestamp integrity.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Audit Log Management Process
clauses.rationale: AU-01 audit policy and procedures; AU-02 event logging definition including what events to log. Process establishment directly covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Collect Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; AU-03 content of audit records; AU-12 audit record generation. Log collection comprehensively covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Ensure Adequate Audit Log Storage
clauses.rationale: AU-04 audit log storage capacity; AU-11 audit record retention. Storage adequacy and retention directly addressed.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Standardize Time Synchronization
clauses.rationale: AU-08 time stamps; SC-45 (new in Rev 5) system time synchronization. Time synchronization for audit log accuracy directly and comprehensively covered by both controls.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SC-45 new in Rev 5 significantly strengthens time synchronization coverage.

clauses.title: Collect Detailed Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-03 audit record content; AU-03(01) additional audit information. Detailed log collection including user, timestamp, source, and destination well covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Collect DNS Query Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events (can include DNS queries); AU-03 audit content; SC-20 secure name/address resolution. DNS query logging partially covered.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires DNS query logging. SP 800-53 supports logging DNS queries through general audit controls but does not specifically mandate DNS query audit logging.

clauses.title: Collect URL Request Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; AU-03 audit content; SI-04 system monitoring. URL request logging partially covered through general audit and monitoring.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires URL request logging. SP 800-53 covers through general audit events and monitoring but URL-specific logging is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Collect Command-Line Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; AU-03 audit content; AU-14 session audit. Command-line logging covered through session audit and general event logging.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically requires command-line audit logging. AU-14 session audit and AU-02/03 cover the intent but command-line specific logging is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Centralize Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-06(04) central review and analysis; SI-04(02) automated real-time analysis tools. Log centralization implied by central review/analysis controls.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. Log centralization is strongly implied by central review/analysis controls.

clauses.title: Retain Audit Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-11 directly addresses audit record retention with organizationally defined retention periods.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifies minimum 90-day retention; AU-11 allows organization to define retention period.

clauses.title: Conduct Audit Log Reviews
clauses.rationale: AU-06 audit review, analysis, and reporting; AU-06(01) automated process integration. Log review directly and comprehensively covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Collect Service Provider Logs
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; SA-09 external system services (includes logging requirements); AU-16 cross-organizational audit logging.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires collecting logs from service providers. SP 800-53 addresses through external service requirements and cross-organizational auditing but explicit service provider log collection is less prescriptive.

clauses.title: Email and Web Browser Protections
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection; SI-03 malware protection; SI-08 spam protection; SC-18 mobile code restrictions. Email and web security addressed through general controls.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers email/web security through general controls. CIS 9 is more prescriptive about specific email and browser hardening configurations.

clauses.title: Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
clauses.rationale: SA-22 unsupported system components; CM-07 least functionality (restrict to supported software). Supported software requirement covered.
clauses.gaps: CIS is specific about browser/email client support currency. SP 800-53 addresses through general component support controls.

clauses.title: Use DNS Filtering Services
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection; SC-20 secure name/address resolution (authoritative); SC-21 secure name/address resolution (recursive). DNS security addressed.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically addresses DNS filtering for malicious domain blocking. SP 800-53 DNS controls focus on integrity (DNSSEC) rather than content filtering. DNS filtering as a protective service is not explicitly mandated.

clauses.title: Maintain and Enforce Network-Based URL Filters
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection including content filtering; SI-03 malware protection; AC-04 information flow enforcement. URL filtering partially covered.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires network-based URL filtering. SP 800-53 covers content filtering through boundary protection but URL-specific filtering is not a dedicated control.

clauses.title: Restrict Unnecessary or Unauthorized Browser and Email Client Extensions
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality (disable unnecessary features); CM-11 user-installed software restrictions. Browser/email extension restrictions covered through general controls.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses browser and email client extensions. CM-07/CM-11 cover the intent through general least functionality and software restriction controls.

clauses.title: Implement DMARC
clauses.rationale: SI-08 spam protection addresses email authentication mechanisms. DMARC is an implementation technique for email authentication.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires DMARC implementation. SP 800-53 covers spam protection generally; DMARC, SPF, and DKIM are specific implementation technologies not individually mandated.

clauses.title: Block Unnecessary File Types
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection with content filtering; SI-03 malware protection; SC-18 mobile code restrictions. File type blocking partially covered.
clauses.gaps: CIS specifically requires blocking unnecessary file types at email/web gateways. SP 800-53 covers through general malware and boundary controls but file type blocking is an implementation detail.

clauses.title: Deploy and Maintain Email Server Anti-Malware Protections
clauses.rationale: SI-03 malicious code protection; SI-08 spam protection. Email server anti-malware directly covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifically addresses email server anti-malware; SI-03 and SI-08 cover this requirement.

clauses.title: Malware Defenses
clauses.rationale: SI-03 malicious code protection with comprehensive enhancements; SI-04 monitoring; SI-08 spam protection; SI-16 memory protection (DEP, ASLR); SC-44 detonation chambers (sandboxing). Rev 5 controls SC-44 and SI-16 strengthen anti-malware coverage.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. Rev 5 additions SC-44 (detonation chambers/sandboxing) and SI-16 (memory protection) provide additional depth.

clauses.title: Deploy and Maintain Anti-Malware Software
clauses.rationale: SI-03 directly covers anti-malware deployment, maintenance, and updating requirements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Signature Updates
clauses.rationale: SI-03(02) directly covers automatic anti-malware mechanism updates including signature files.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Disable Autorun and Autoplay for Removable Media
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality (disable unnecessary features like autorun); MP-07 media use restrictions. Autorun/autoplay disabling covered through configuration hardening.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CIS specifically addresses autorun/autoplay; CM-07 and MP-07 cover this as a configuration hardening and media use control.

clauses.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Scanning of Removable Media
clauses.rationale: SI-03(01) central management of anti-malware mechanisms; MP-07 media use. Removable media scanning covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Enable Anti-Exploitation Features
clauses.rationale: SI-16 memory protection (DEP, ASLR, and other anti-exploitation features); CM-06 configuration settings for enabling exploitation mitigation features. Strong mapping with SI-16.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SI-16 directly addresses memory protection mechanisms including DEP and ASLR which are the primary anti-exploitation features.

clauses.title: Centrally Manage Anti-Malware Software
clauses.rationale: SI-03(01) central management of malicious code protection mechanisms. Direct mapping for centralized anti-malware management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Use Behavior-Based Anti-Malware Software
clauses.rationale: SI-03 malware protection; SI-04(04) inbound/outbound analysis; SC-44 detonation chambers (sandboxing/dynamic analysis). SC-44 directly supports behavior-based detection through dynamic execution environments.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses behavior-based detection (EDR/XDR). SP 800-53 covers through general malware, monitoring controls, and SC-44 detonation chambers. The combination provides strong coverage.

clauses.title: Data Recovery
clauses.rationale: CP-09 system backup; CP-06 alternate storage site; CP-10 system recovery and reconstitution. Comprehensive data recovery.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Recovery Process
clauses.rationale: CP-09 backup requirements; CP-02 contingency plan including recovery procedures and responsibilities.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Perform Automated Backups
clauses.rationale: CP-09 backup; CP-09(01) testing of reliability and integrity of backup. Automated backup concept covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Protect Recovery Data
clauses.rationale: CP-09 backup protection; CP-06 alternate storage site; SC-28 protection of information at rest (backup encryption). Recovery data protection well covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Establish and Maintain an Isolated Instance of Recovery Data
clauses.rationale: CP-06 alternate storage site with separation from primary; CP-09 backup. Air-gapped/isolated backup concept supported.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CIS specifically addresses isolated recovery data instances (air-gapped backups). CP-06 covers alternate storage but the specific isolation/air-gap requirement is less explicitly mandated.

clauses.title: Test Data Recovery
clauses.rationale: CP-04 contingency plan testing; CP-09(01) testing reliability and integrity of backup information. Recovery testing directly covered.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Network Infrastructure Management
